Subjective: Stress-related symptoms: palpitations, rapid breathing, muscle tension. Meds: None. Negatives: No chest pain, no dizziness, no light-headedness. Social: Doctor, lives with housemates (also doctors), good support system. ICE: Worried about physical cause, wants to rule out anaemia.
Objective: BP: 120/60. HR: 65/min. Oxygen level: 98%. Respiratory rate: 14/min. Normal heart sounds, no murmurs. Lungs: clear breath sounds, no abnormalities.
Assessment: Stress-related symptoms, likely due to busy work schedule. Ruled out: anaemia (pending blood test results).
Plan: 1. Blood test: haemoglobin, thyroid values, liver and kidney function. 2. Consultation with mental health nurse. 3. Advice: build moments of relaxation into daily life, maintain regularity, consider occupational health and safety service. 4. Follow-up: call practice for blood test results or check online portal.
